reviews.review_text: This book is a very low quality print. The cover art is blurry and the size of the book is so large for a soft cover. I would recommend buying a different version.
Excellent demonstration of the Wilde`s capacity to create a morbid environment in a very classic fashion. Full of references, it's mandatory for anyone that digs into timeless sci-fi and terror.

The Picture of Dorian GrayThis semester I read the novel,  The Picture of Dorian Gray, by Oscar Wilde. The main plot of the story revolves around a man named Dorian Gray, who captivates the attention of an artist, Basil Hallward. Basil spends his days painting portraits of Dorian, until one day Lord Henry casually has a conversation with Dorian about the fleeting nature of beauty and youth. After this discussion, Dorian has an outburst, as he begins to see the paintings as a reminder that he will one day lose his youth. However, these portraits will stay with him, and change as he changes.As the story continues, I began seeing Dorian as very unstable, and defiantly dealing with mental illness. Dorian becomes engaged to a young actress named Sibyl, who eventually commits suicide after Dorian ends the engagement. The book then fast forwards eighteen years, when Basil approaches Dorian after hearing Dorians reputation being tarnished throughout London. The interaction between Dorian and Basil ends with Dorian murdering Basil. A few months pass by and Dorian grows older, and crazier. When Dorian, finds his portrait he uses the same knife he used to kill Basil to try and destroy it. However, the story ends with Dorian's servants opening the door to see Dorian with a knife plunged through his heart, and the portrait of Dorian as a young man lying beside him. Overall I truly enjoyed reading this book. I found the plot to be very interesting because I enjoy reading about the dark aspects of human nature. Although I liked the majority of the book, I found some parts of the plot confusing. The murder of James Vane
An exceptional rendition of this classic.  Very enjoyable listening on a quiet night...
I simply want to move along to the next book. I have nothing insightful to share about this classic that has not already been said many times over.

summary:
The Picture of Dorian Gray is an 1891 philosophical novel by Irish writer and playwright Oscar Wilde. 

First published as a serial story in the July 1890 issue of Lippincott's Monthly Magazine, the editors feared the story was indecent, and without Wilde's knowledge, deleted five hundred words before publication. 

Despite that censorship, The Picture of Dorian Gray offended the moral sensibilities of British book reviewers, some of whom said that Oscar Wilde merited prosecution for violating the laws guarding the public morality. In response, Wilde aggressively defended his novel and art in correspondence with the British press. 

Wilde revised and expanded the magazine edition of The Picture of Dorian Gray (1890) for publication as a novel; the book edition (1891) featured an aphoristic preface — an apologia about the art of the novel and the reader. 

The content, style, and presentation of the preface made it famous in its own literary right, as social and cultural criticism. In April 1891, the editorial house Ward, Lock and Company published the revised version of The Picture of Dorian Gray.
